case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial remains with soft tissues
case_address_found_1: 1 Mile N of Fish Finder's Bay
case_circumstances: Badly decomposed remains of Caucasian female found partially buried in shallow grave in an unnamed cove of Lake Mead National Recreational Area approximately 1 mile North of Fish Finder's Bay.  Area could only be accessed via boat, indicating the decedent was transported to the cove by boat.  Decedent was found to be approximately 4 months pregnant with a female fetus.  She had short to medium brown hair and was noted to have a medium build.  She was wearing a pair of black or dark blue polyester-type slacks, a beige or light brown stretch knit-type top, a yellow metal necklace with a large crucifix (approx. 1" x 1 1/2" in diameter) and a yellow metal ring without a stone on hand.
case_head_hair: Medium brown hair, measured at 3 1/2-4" in length.
case_clothing_on_body: Black or dark blue polyester-type slacks and beige or light brown stretch knit-type top (tube top).
case_jewelry: Yellow metal necklace with large crucifix, approx. 1' x 1 1/2" in diameter. Yellow metal ring missing stone
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
